verses.text: \w Benjamin|strong="H1144"\w* \w was|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H3205"\w* \w Bela|strong="H1106"\w*, \w his|strong="H3205"\w* \w firstborn|strong="H1060"\w*; Ashbel \w was|strong="H3205"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w second|strong="H8145"\w* \w born|strong="H3205"\w*, Aharah \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w third|strong="H7992"\w*,
\w Nohah|strong="H5119"\w* \w the|strong="H7243"\w* \w fourth|strong="H7243"\w*, \w and|strong="H2549"\w* \w Rapha|strong="H7498"\w* \w the|strong="H7243"\w* \w fifth|strong="H2549"\w*.
The sons of Bela: Addar, Gera, Abihud,\f + \fr 8:3 \ft Possibly Gera the father of Ehud; see verse 7.\f*
Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
These were the descendants of Ehud who were the heads of the families living in Geba and were exiled to Manahath:
Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who carried them into exile and who was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.\f + \fr 8:7 \ft Or and Gera, that is Heglam, who was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.\f*
Shaharaim had sons in the country of Moab after he had divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.
His sons by his wife Hodesh: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
Jeuz, Sachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of families.
He also had sons by Hushim: Abitub and Elpaal.
The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, Shemed (who built Ono and Lod with its villages),
and Beriah and Shema (who were the heads of families of the inhabitants of Aijalon and who drove out the inhabitants of Gath).
Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
All these were heads of families, the chiefs according to their genealogies, and they lived in Jerusalem.
Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived \f + \fr 8:29 \ft Some LXX manuscripts (see also 1 Chronicles 9:35); Hebrew The father of Gibeon lived\f* in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maacah,
and Abdon was his firstborn son, then Zur, Kish, Baal,\f + \fr 8:30 \ft Some LXX manuscripts include Ner; see 1 Chronicles 9:36.\f* Nadab,
Gedor, Ahio, Zecher,\f + \fr 8:31 \ft Zecher is likely a variant of Zechariah; see 1 Chronicles 9:37.\f*
and Mikloth, who was the father of Shimeah.\f + \fr 8:32 \ft Shimeah is a variant of Shimeam; see 1 Chronicles 9:38.\f* These also lived alongside their relatives in Jerusalem. The Family of Saul

\w Ner|strong="H5369"\w* \w was|strong="H7586"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H3205"\w* \w Kish|strong="H7027"\w*, \w Kish|strong="H7027"\w* \w was|strong="H7586"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H3205"\w* \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w*, \w and|strong="H7586"\w* \w Saul|strong="H7586"\w* \w was|strong="H7586"\w* \w the|strong="H3205"\w* \w father|strong="H3205"\w* \w of|strong="H3205"\w* \w Jonathan|strong="H3083"\w*, Malchishua, Abinadab, \w and|strong="H7586"\w* Esh-baal.\f + \fr 8:33 \ft Esh-baal is also called Ish-bosheth; see 2 Samuel 2:8.\f*

The son of Jonathan: Merib-baal,\f + \fr 8:34 \ft Merib-baal is also called Mephibosheth; see 2 Samuel 4:4.\f* and Merib-baal was the father of Micah.\f + \fr 8:34 \ft Micah is a variant of Mica; see 2 Samuel 9:12.\f*
The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tarea,\f + \fr 8:35 \ft Tarea is a variant of Tahrea; see 1 Chronicles 9:41.\f* and Ahaz.

Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah, Jehoaddah \f + \fr 8:36 \ft Jehoaddah is a variant of Jarah or Jadah; see 1 Chronicles 9:42.\f* was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.
Moza was the father of Binea. Raphah \f + \fr 8:37 \ft Raphah is a variant of Rephaiah; see 1 Chronicles 9:43.\f* was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
The sons of his brother Eshek: Ulam was his firstborn, Jeush second, and Eliphelet third.

The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and they had many sons and grandsons—150 in all. \w All|strong="H3605"\w* \w these|strong="H3605"\w* \w were|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Benjamin|strong="H1144"\w*.
